data.author: Nidhi Sinha
data.content: Delhi High Court on Thursday denied bail to jailed AAP leader and ex-Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in a money laundering case being probed by Enforcement Directorate. The bail pleas of co-accused Vaibhav Jain and Ankush Jain were also denied. HC said the three failed to meet and pass the conditions specified for bail under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.
data.title: HC rejects bail plea of former Delhi minister Satyendar Jain

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: Salman Khan has said that there are "so many awards" at his home that he and his family members have used the trophies "as door-stoppers when the hinge broke". Salman added, "When we did not have enough space, we would give it to others." He added that 'the love and respect' of fans matter more to him.
data.title: We have so many awards at home, we used trophies as door-stoppers: Salman Khan

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: John Cena's post welcoming Priyanka Chopra aboard a new film has gone viral on social media. "Excited to get to work on #HeadsOfState with Idris Elba and welcome the newest cast member, the world renowned Priyanka Chopra!" Cena wrote. "Thank you for the warm welcome John Cena. I can't wait to get to set!" Priyanka replied.
data.title: Cena's post for 'world renowned' Priyanka goes viral as he welcomes her aboard new film

data.author: Medhaa Gupta
data.content: An FIR has been filed against a rapper based in Maharashtra's Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar over an alleged defamatory song against the ruling Shiv Sena-BJP government. A leader of Shiv Sena's youth wing had filed the complaint, claiming that she came across a video of Raj Mungase performing a rap, which contained abusive language and objectionable remarks against the Shiv Sena-BJP alliance.
data.title: Rapper booked for abusive song on Maharashtra's Sena-BJP govt

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: A South African pilot has been praised and called an "absolute hero" after he landed a plane safely despite spotting a highly venomous Cape cobra in the cockpit. The cobra reportedly reared its head mid-flight (in a threat display) and the pilot Rudolf Erasmus spotted it sliding under his seat. Erasmus didn't inform the passengers and made an emergency landing.
data.title: Pilot lands plane safely with venomous cobra under his seat in South Africa

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: A job advertisement on Indeed has been criticised as it asked for only "white" applicants in US. Arthur Grand Technologies responded to the job advertisement and said, "This job posting was neither authorized nor posted by Arthur Grand or its employees. A former employee took an existing posting and added discriminatory language, then reposted it through his own account."
data.title: Pic shows job opening for only 'whites' in US; company says ex-employee posted it

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: Airports Council International World has revealed the top 10 busiest airports in the world. Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta (ATL) topped the list followed by Dallas/Fort Worth (DFW), Denver (DEN) and Chicago O'Hare (ORD). Dubai International Airport has been ranked 5th, followed by Los Angeles International Airport, Istanbul Airport, London's Heathrow Airport and Delhi's IGI Airport.
data.title: Which are the world's top 10 busiest airports?

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: Actor Richard Madden has said that he would be honoured to work in India. "India makes more movies than any other country in the world and has an incredible amount of talent," he added. Richard, who featured in 'Game of Thrones', will next star in the series 'Citadel' alongside actress Priyanka Chopra.
data.title: India makes more movies than any other country: Richard Madden

data.author: Kameshwari
data.content: Telugu actor Nani-starrer 'Dasara' has crossed ₹100 crore worldwide in six days of its release. On Wednesday, Nani shared a poster that featured the box office collection of the film along with which he wrote, "Our effort. Your gift. Cinema wins." Directed by Srikanth Odela, the film is reportedly Nani's first film to breach ₹100 crore mark.
data.title: Nani's film 'Dasara' earns ₹100 crore worldwide, actor reacts

data.author: Kameshwari
data.content: Filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah recalled that when he narrated the script of 'Aankhen' to Amitabh Bachchan, he agreed to do the film "without even taking the signing amount". "[He] was always the only choice in my mind [for the role]...[I and Aatish Kapadia] used to say that...we will create history by casting Amit ji for the negative role," Vipul shared.
data.title: Big B agreed to do 'Aankhen' without taking signing amount: Maker

data.author: Kameshwari
data.content: Salman Khan revealed that his entire team had told him to not use 'Naiyo Lagda' song in his upcoming film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. "They said it seems outdated and turns out, it became the biggest hit song (from the film). I love it," Salman said. The song, which also features Pooja Hegde, was trolled for the choreography.
data.title: Was told 'Naiyo Lagda' is outdated, don't use in 'Kisi...': Salman

data.author: Kameshwari
data.content: Filmmaker Siddharth Anand has reportedly been roped in to direct 'Tiger vs Pathaan'. The film will star Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan. "Siddharth is getting...[SRK] and Salman...together for their first full-fledged film since 'Karan Arjun'...He'll...be given all the support he needs to mount 'Tiger vs Pathaan' as the biggest film...India has ever produced," a source told Deadline.
data.title: Siddharth Anand to helm Salman-SRK's 'Tiger vs Pathaan': Report

data.author: Arnab Mukherji
data.content: Real Madrid players were seen celebrating following their 4-0 win against Barcelona in the second leg of their Copa del Rey semi-final, which marked the club's first win by at least a four-goal margin against Barcelona since 1995. The players were seen hugging each other and dancing in a video of the celebrations shared by Real Madrid's official YouTube account.
data.title: Real Madrid share video of celebrations after 4-0 win vs Barcelona

data.author: Arnab Mukherji
data.content: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said SRH pacer Umran Malik had once told him that he would hit Chahal for three sixes. "He did not. Very bad," stated Chahal, referring to Umran's inability to hit sixes against him when RR faced SRH in their IPL 2023 opener. Umran faced one delivery off Chahal where he failed to score any runs.
data.title: Umran told me 'Whenever we meet, I'll hit you for 3 sixes': Chahal

data.author: Arnab Mukherji
data.content: Ex-KXIP (now PBKS) mentor Virender Sehwag said David Miller, who represents GT, didn't feature in the playing XI for KXIP during his last season with them as he'd recorded one double-digit score in 50 innings. "Miller came to my room...said, 'I'm playing good'. When I showed Miller the stats, he was shocked. He asked, 'Is this real?'" added Sehwag.
data.title: Miller once got only 1 double-digit score in 50 innings: Sehwag

data.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
data.content: Ofcom, UK's communications regulator, said it has "significant concerns" that Amazon and Microsoft could be harming competition in the market for cloud services. Ofcom said it was "particularly concerned" by the practices of Amazon Web Services and Microsoft, which have a combined market share of 60-70%. It has proposed referring to the Competition and Markets Authority for further investigation.
data.title: Amazon, Microsoft face UK antitrust probe over cloud services

data.author: Ayushi Jain
data.content: Congress leader Amitesh Shukla on Wednesday said that Rahul Gandhi is "Mahatma Gandhi of modern India". "Rahul has a lot of similarities with Mahatma Gandhi...Rahul walked thousands of kilometres in 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' [whereas] Mahatma Gandhi walked in Dandi March," he added. Shukla further said Rahul is speaking the "truth fearlessly", just like Mahatma Gandhi spoke against the British empire.
data.title: Rahul is Mahatma Gandhi of modern India: Congress' Amitesh Shukla

data.author: Medhaa Gupta
data.content: Haryana government has drafted AYUSH medical reimbursement policy to benefit government staffers, pensioners and their dependants, officials said. People were facing difficulty in getting their bills reimbursed "with there being no empanelled AYUSH hospital", an official said. Government AYUSH institutions and private AYUSH hospitals with certain certificates will get empanelled under the policy.
data.title: H'yana drafts AYUSH medical reimbursement policy for govt staffers

data.author: Ayushi Jain
data.content: A video has surfaced online that shows traffic policemen pushing a broken-down concrete mixer truck on road along with other people in Pune's Katraj. "Unexpected obstacles can cause difficulty, but with quick thinking and teamwork, the situation can be handled," Pune City Traffic Police tweeted while sharing the video. The incident took place at Katraj Chowk.
data.title: Pune traffic policemen push broken-down truck on road, video out

data.author: Subhangi Singh
data.content: Mosques and dargahs have been covered in Hyderabad ahead of the Hanuman Jayanti procession which will be taken out in the city today. The main procession will be taken out from Gowliguda Ram Mandir at 11:30 am. Meanwhile, over 2,000 police personnel from different wings of Hyderabad Police have been deployed across the city to maintain law and order.
data.title: Mosques, dargahs covered for Hanuman Jayanti Yatra in Hyderabad

data.author: Subhangi Singh
data.content: A woman died after she was found unconscious at a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) swimming pool in Mumbai's Chembur. The 61-year-old woman came for a swim in the morning batch along with husband. The guards found her unconscious inside the pool and took her out and then rushed her to the hospital in an auto where she was declared dead.
data.title: Woman falls unconscious in BMC swimming pool; dies

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: A video showing a skier rescuing a snowboarder stuck in a tree well on Mount Baker in US' Washington has surfaced online. Francis Zuber rescued Ian Steger after he saw the latter's snowboard sticking out the snow. Tree wells occur when the space under a tree does not get the same amount of snow as surrounding areas, causing a sinkhole.
data.title: Skier digs out man buried under deep snow in US; video surfaces

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: Amazon will shut down its UK-based global online bookstore Book Depository. The announcement comes amid Amazon's efforts to reduce its workforce to reduce costs. The bookseller stated that it will cease operations on April 26 but continue to provide support to customers with their orders until June 23. The company was bought by Amazon in 2011.
data.title: Amazon to close UK-based Book Depository amid cost cuts

data.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
data.content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday announced that the real GDP forecast for FY24 has been increased to 6.5% from 6.4% earlier. Real GDP in Q1 is forecast to grow at 7.8%, Q2 at 6.2%, Q3 at 6.1% and Q4 at 5.9%. RBI has kept the repo rate unchanged at 6.50%. Further, inflation for FY24 is projected at 5.2%.
data.title: India's GDP to grow at 6.5% in FY24: RBI Governor

data.author: Ambarish Awale
data.content: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has cut its forecast for inflation in 2023-24 from 5.3% to 5.2%, Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Thursday. "Cost conditions have somewhat eased...On the upside, adverse climatic conditions are a risk to future inflation trajectory. The rising uncertainty in international financial markets and imported inflation pressures need to be monitored," he added.
data.title: India's inflation expected to be at 5.2% in FY24: RBI Governor Das
